Healthy plant-based diet index (hPDI): Based on
• Emphasizes high-quality plant foods, including whole grains,
associations between quality or specific types
fruits, vegetables, nuts, legumes, vegetable oils, tea, and coffee
of plant foods and chronic disease outcomes in large cohorts
• Limits low-quality plant foods, such as fruit juices, refined grains, potatoes, sugar-sweetened beverages, and
sweets/desserts
• Contains low amounts of all animal foods

• Abundant vegetables, fruits, whole grains, legumes, nuts, and

unsaturated oils
and planetary health

Alternate healthy eating index (AHEI): Based on
• Higher intakes of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, nuts, and
Harvard's Healthy Eating Plate
legumes
• Frequent consumption of fish and seafood
• Use olive oil or other vegetable oils high in unsaturated fats

• Limit consumption of red and processed meats
• Limit sodium
• Moderate consumption of alcohol
